alert.note: Alert for Northern Fairfield (Connecticut) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 10 at 12:09AM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT NORTH CENTRAL FAIRFIELD... NORTHERN WESTCHESTER AND PUTNAM COUNTIES THROUGH 100 AM EDT... At 1208 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Fahnestock State Park to near Mount Kisco. Movement was northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Danbury, Mount Kisco, Mahopac, Lake Carmel, Sherman, Brewster, Ridgefield, Bethel, Brookfield, New Fairfield, Carmel, Yorktown Heights, Fahnestock State Park, Jefferson Valley, and Patterson. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
